bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to the Adjutant General, U.S. Army, December 11, 1924

div1.p: Kean requests that Kissinger's address be given to the dean of Harvard Medical School.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to the Adjutant General, U.S. Army, December 11, 1924
div1.opener:
COPY
1st. Ind.
Col. J. R. Kean, USA, Ret., Army Medical Museum, Washn.
D.C., Dec. 11, 1924. To The Adjutant General U.S. Army,
Washington, D.C.
div1.p:
1. I believe that Mrs. John R. Kissinger receives
an annuity in the annual appropriation bill for the Army.
It is requested, therefore, that this letter be referred to
the proper office to obtain her address as requested by the
Dean of the Medical School, Harvard University. If the
information is furnished direct to Dr. Edsall, it is requested
that I be furnished a carbon copy.
div1.closer:
(Signed) J. R. Kean
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retired. 1 incl.
